intro: Rinzia ericaea subsp. insularis, commonly known as the island rinzia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heaths and heaths. This subspecies is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. The plant plays an important role in its native ecosystem, supporting local insect and bird populations.
